alert.note: Alert for Montgomery; Treutlen; Wheeler (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 16 at 11:51AM EST until January 19 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Peachtree City GA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Georgia... Oconee River near Mount Vernon affecting Treutlen, Wheeler and Montgomery Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO EARLY FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Oconee River near Mount Vernon. * WHEN...From this afternoon to early Friday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 17 feet, Minor flooding continues in the woodlands and pastures upstream and downstream from the gage on U.S. Highway 280. Some homes on Dead River Road in the south end of Montgomery County become surrounded by water. Water begins to cover lower portions of Dead River Road. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:00 AM EST Tuesday the stage was 15.8 feet and rising. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this afternoon to a crest of 16.7 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage Friday morning. - Flood stage is 16 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta. The next statement will be issued late tonight at midnight EST.
